item.title: Remembering the Santa Fe Hotel & Casino: A Vintage Las Vegas Oasis for Locals
item.description:
A Different Kind of Vegas Dream: The Santa Fe’s Arrival

The Las Vegas Strip gets all the glory, but a different kind of Vegas story unfolded just a few miles away. In February 1991, the Santa Fe Hotel and Casino opened its doors at 4949 North Rancho Drive, a bold experiment in catering not to tourists, but to the growing population of Las Vegas residents. Developed by Paul Lowdenâ€™s Santa Fe Gaming Corporation, it was a deliberate departure from the glitz and glamour of the Strip, aiming instead to be a full-scale resort for families and locals in the underserved northwest valley.
